articles.headline: The Challenges Facing Sam Bankman-Fried’s Lawyers
articles.snippet: They are set to start their defense on Thursday, with the FTX founder planning to testify in his criminal fraud trial. Hurdles include what Mr. Bankman-Fried’s former associates said on the stand.
articles.abstract: They are set to start their defense on Thursday, with the FTX founder planning to testify in his criminal fraud trial. Hurdles include what Mr. Bankman-Fried’s former associates said on the stand.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow live coverage of Sam Bankman-Fried’s testimony in the FTX fraud case.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein, David Yaffe-Bellany and J. Edward Moreno

articles.headline: Israel’s Strikes on Gaza Are Some of the Most Intense This Century
articles.snippet: In the 19 days since Hamas attacked Israel, the Israeli military says it has struck more than 7,000 targets in Gaza. Palestinians accuse Israel of indiscriminately targeting civilians, but Israel officials say the strikes are aimed at eroding mili...
articles.abstract: In the 19 days since Hamas attacked Israel, the Israeli military says it has struck more than 7,000 targets in Gaza. Palestinians accuse Israel of indiscriminately targeting civilians, but Israel officials say the strikes are aimed at eroding military infrastructure.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israel’s 19-day bombing campaign in Gaza has become one of the most intense of the 21st century, prompting growing global scrutiny of its scale, purpose and cost to human life.

articles.headline: Inside Google’s Plan to Stop Apple From Getting Serious About Search
articles.snippet: Google has worried for years that Apple would one day expand its internet search technology, and has been working on ways to prevent that from happening.
articles.abstract: Google has worried for years that Apple would one day expand its internet search technology, and has been working on ways to prevent that from happening.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, Google watched with increasing concern as Apple improved its search technology, not knowing whether its longtime partner and sometimes competitor would eventually build its own search engine.

articles.headline: Who Decides Penn’s Future: Donors or the University?
articles.snippet: Some alumni want the president to resign. They are angry about a Palestinian conference and Penn’s response to the Hamas attacks — as well as D.E.I. and transgender rights.
articles.abstract: Some alumni want the president to resign. They are angry about a Palestinian conference and Penn’s response to the Hamas attacks — as well as D.E.I. and transgender rights.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the two days after Hamas killed hundreds of men, women and children in a surprise attack on Israel, the University of Pennsylvania had not reached out to its students or alumni with an official statement.

articles.headline: Why the U.A.W.’s President Has Taken a Hard Line
articles.snippet: Shawn Fain owes his rise within the United Automobile Workers to a group determined to make the union far more confrontational toward automakers.
articles.abstract: Shawn Fain owes his rise within the United Automobile Workers to a group determined to make the union far more confrontational toward automakers.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Shawn Fain sought the presidency of the United Automobile Workers union last year, he ran on a platform that promised: “No corruption. No concessions. No tiers.”

articles.headline: What’s Happening in the Bond Market?
articles.snippet: The rapid rise in interest rates in recent months has shaken investors and cast a cloud over the economy.
articles.abstract: The rapid rise in interest rates in recent months has shaken investors and cast a cloud over the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The interest rates on mortgages, credit cards and business loans have shot up in recent months, even as the Federal Reserve has left its key rate unchanged since July. The rapid rise has startled investors and put policymakers in a tough spot.

articles.headline: U.S. Economic Growth Accelerated in the Third Quarter
articles.snippet: Gross domestic product expanded at a 4.9 percent annual rate over the summer, powered by prodigious consumer spending. But the pace is not expected to be sustained.
articles.abstract: Gross domestic product expanded at a 4.9 percent annual rate over the summer, powered by prodigious consumer spending. But the pace is not expected to be sustained.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States economy surged in the third quarter as a strong job market and falling inflation gave consumers the confidence to spend freely on goods and services.

articles.headline: Texas Lawmakers Vote to Let Local Police Arrest Migrants
articles.snippet: The proposal, which has now cleared both houses of the Legislature, poses a direct challenge to the federal government’s authority over policing the borders.
articles.abstract: The proposal, which has now cleared both houses of the Legislature, poses a direct challenge to the federal government’s authority over policing the borders.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a direct challenge to federal power over immigration, the Texas House on Thursday approved the creation of a state-level crime for entering the country from Mexico between ports of entry, allowing local police agencies to arrest and jail unauthorized migrants or order them back to Mexico.
